subject: Travel
title: Digital Preservation of Ruins
description: A short lesson to help you apply Digital Preservation of Ruins.

hook.text: When ISIS destroyed the Temple of Bel in Palmyra, it seemed gone forever.

buildup.text: But thousands of tourist photos existed. Researchers fed them into 3D modeling software.

discovery.text: Using photogrammetry, they rebuilt a precise digital model of the temple from crowdsourced images.

twist.text: A full-scale replica of Palmyra's arch was 3D-printed and displayed in London and New York.

climax.text: Projects like CyArk have now scanned over 200 heritage sites as digital insurance.

punchline.text: Tourist selfies helped rebuild a destroyed temple.

quiz.question: How was the Temple of Bel digitally reconstructed?
options: Old blueprints found in a museum
